Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Megina Sherice Bruton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Negligent Handling of Burning Material, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.10(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs/surcharges to be paid from bond posted.

Provide a DNA sample;
Comply with any assessment or counseling set up by Probation & Parole.

timeConds.notes: Serve 10 days in the Pepin County Jail with credit for 10 days served.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
With work release and release for treatment.  Will give credit for the last 30 days of jail for inpatient treatment.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence.  Pepin County Case 2017CM43 and 2017CM48 concurrent to 2016CF23.

records.addlTxt: Letter of support

Defendant Megina Sherice Bruton in court with attorney Steven Hughes.  Defendant Megina Sherice Bruton in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached on unresolved cases; 2 new cases State will requst concurrent jail to sentence after revocation.  Court advises defendant of violation of harassment Injunction/max. penalties and obstructing an officer/max. penalties.  Defendant enters plea of no contest to each charge.  Plea colloquy.  Court finds based upon the file a factual foundation exists for the charge, find defendant's waiver of her constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts pleas and find defendant guilty.  State confirms complied with victim notification requirements and informs there are no victim impact statements;  recommends 30 days on each of 2 class A misdemeanors and 9 months on revocation case and allow 30 day sentences to run concurrent to 9 months with 56 days jail credit.  Atty Hughes submits letter to court.  Court informs read the letter previously filed as well.  Defense in agreement with 56 days jail credit and with the 30 days on each misdemeanor; disagree with 9 months;  ask 4 months in jail; the longest time she's been sentenced to jail is 30 days; reason not suggesting probation is she's on MN probation for the next 2-3 years.  Defendant addresses the court.  Court sentences defendant to 8 months, top of the recommendation, but less than what the DA is asking, with work release, with release for treatment, if you can line it up and find a funding source will give you credit for the last 30 days of jail for inpatient treatment.  Credit for 56 days served.  Enter judgment for any unpaid obligations and waive costs on the 2 misdemeanors cases.  On the 2 misdemeanors, 30 days on each concurrent with the jail on the 8 months on the revoked case all consecutive to any other sentence.  Atty Hughes wishes to clarify on the 2 misdemeanors, the 30 days are concurrent to 8 months?  Court confirms 30 days concurrent to 8 months and all consecutive to any other sentence.  Advised of appeal rights.
Refund balance of bond after applying $443.00 to costs.

Defendant Megina Sherice Bruton now appears in court with attorney Roger M. Hillestad.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached.  Defendant will plead to amended count 1, 941.10, State will DRI counts 2, 3, 4.  Court advises defendant of amended charge negligent handling of burning material Wis. Stats. 941.10/max penalties.  Defendant pleads no contest to amend charge.  PLQ/WOR form filed with the court and reviewed with defendant.  Court finds defendant's WCR & Plea done K&V, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty.
Attorney Roger M. Hillestad in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant f/t/a.  Warrant authorized.
NOH mailed to Megina Bruton ret'd to sender, attempted not known, unable to forward.
Status conference on October 31, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Roger M. Hillestad in court.  Defendant had f/t/a, had car trouble.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached, State needs couple weeks.  Court refers counsel to scheduling clerk for new date and informs State to comply with victim rights and have restitution information.
NOH mailed to defendant ret'd to sender, attempted not known, unable to forward.
Status conference on October 4, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Motion hearing on September 19, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Megina Sherice Bruton in court with attorney Roger M. Hillestad.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to continue trial filed by Atty Hillestad.  No objection by State.  Jury trial to be taken off court calendar, motion hearing to be scheduled @ a month.
Letter from Atty Seifert in response to Court's Memo regarding waiver of speedy trial.
Memo from Circuit Court Judge to counsel re: Mr. Hillestad's request to reschedule the JT without much indication why necessary.  Matter to be taken up at the MH on 7/5/16.
Defendant's Waiver of Speedy Trial
Atty Roger Hillestad appt'd.

Motion hearing on July 5, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Final pre-trial on July 19, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial on August 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Megina Sherice Bruton in court with attorney Roger M. Hillestad.  Defendant Megina Sherice Bruton in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of charges as stated in the Information, maximum penalties and constitutional rights.  NGP entered on all counts.  Atty Hillestad requests speedy trial and be heard on bond; requests lesser bond amount. Court orders bond remain as previously set, notes Injunctions granted yesterday.  Counsel referred to scheduling clerk to set 2 day JT, MH date.

Jury Trial Scheduling Order:
1.  Trial of this matter is set for jury trial on August 8 & 9, 2016.  Time allowed for trial is 2 days.
2.  The District Attorney will send the Defense Atty their settlement offer prior to the FPT.
3.  The Defense Atty shall review the DA's settlement offer with his/her client prior to the FPT.
4.  A FPT is set for July 29, 2016 at 11:00 a.m.
5.  The Defense Atty, the Defendant, and the District Atty shall all personally appear at the FPT.
Failure of the Defendant to appear personally at the FPT shall result in the cancellation of the trial date and a warrant being issued for the defendant's arrest.
6.  All motions shall be filed in writing and no later than June 17, 2016. ....
If a motion is filed, the filing attorney shall contact the Court and obtain a pretrial motion hearing date.
Notices of alibi and responses shall follow the time limits and other requirements of Sec. 971.23(8) Wis. Stats.
7.  If either side intends to offer expert testimony..., such party shall give written notice to the court and opposing counsel no later than June 17, 2016, of the name, address and qualifications of the expert, the opinions which will be solicited from such expert and the basis for those opinions. .... 
For complete Order see file.

Defendant Megina Sherice Bruton in court with attorney Roger M. Hillestad.  Defendant Megina Sherice Bruton in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Matchey Sworn & testifies.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  State files Information with the court.
Preliminary hearing on May 17, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Megina Sherice Bruton in court with attorney Roger M. Hillestad.  Defendant Megina Sherice Bruton in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Hillestad requests reduced cash bond. State updated the court on previous statements and has determined that is not an active warrant for her out of Michigan; notes her past criminal history.  Atty Hillestad requests reduced cash bond.  Court modifies bond to $2500 cash.  Atty Hillestad requests PH w/in 10 days.  Referred to scheduling clerk.

Defendant Megina Sherice Bruton not in court, appears by phone from Pepin County Jail with Jailer, Amanda Swenson.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of charges/max. penalties and constitutional rights; right to preliminary hearing within 10 days if in custody, 20 days if not.  State requests $5000 cash bond.  Court sets $5000 cash bond.  Court encourages defendant to call the PD office.  Matter set to tomorrow.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 11:15 am.
